title: Here's why you should be worried about American democracy right now
description: Republicans want to move on from the January 6 insurrection, arguing it's time to focus on the future.

title: Netflix stands by Dave Chappelle's special
description: Netflix is defending Dave Chappelle's new comedy special after it has been criticized as transphobic by some LGBTQ+ advocates, artists and employees.

title: Scientists looked at more than 100,000 studies and found the world has a giant climate-crisis blind spot
description: Scientists using artificial intelligence to sift through around 100,000 climate studies were trying to put a number on how many people in the world were already experiencing the impacts of the climate crisis.

title: Gas prices skyrocket as the global energy crisis gets worse
Taliban's religious police told to be more moderate, but vulnerable Afghans say brutal justice is still being meted out
Gas prices skyrocket as the global energy crisis gets worse
Whistleblower Frances Haugen will meet with Facebook Oversight Board
description: Facebook whistleblower Frances Haugen will meet with the social network's independent court-like oversight board in the coming weeks to discuss her concerns about the company, the Facebook Oversight Board said Monday.

title: Lava from La Palma volcano sparks factory fire, pushing 2,500 people into lockdown
description: Lava flowing from the Cumbre Vieja volcano on Spain's La Palma island sparked a fire at a cement factory Monday, leading to at least 2,500 residents to be ordered into lockdown to protect their health, a local official said.

title: Video shows US police officers dragging Black paraplegic man out of car during traffic stop
description: A Black paraplegic man from Ohio has filed a complaint with the NAACP after video showed police officers pulling him out of his car by his hair and arms during a traffic stop late last month.

title: The first IRONMAN with Down syndrome turns his winning moment into a growing movement for inclusion
description: Chris Nikic's journey to becoming an elite athlete began with a single step. What kept him going was a single recipe for success: get "1 percent better" every day.

title: ISIS finance chief captured by Iraqi forces, Iraq PM says
description: Iraqi forces captured Sami Jasim, the deputy of former ISIS leader Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi, Iraq's Prime Minister said in a statement on Monday.

title: Flight attendants trade heels for sneakers on Ukraine's SkyUp Airlines
description: Alexandrina Denysenko, a senior flight attendant with seven years of experience, says she sometimes does not get a spare minute to sit down during a flight and dreams of resting her swollen legs after spending hours wearing heels.

title: Man builds rotating house so his wife has better views
description: Vojin Kusic from Srbac in Bosnia-Herzegovina says his wife was undecided about the view she wanted to see from their window, so he came up with a solution - a rotating house.

title: Paul McCartney says it was John Lennon who broke up the Beatles
description: When the biggest band in British musical history, the Beatles, broke up in 1970, fans pointed the finger at co-lead vocalist Paul McCartney.

title: Hidden Picasso nude revealed and brought to life with artificial intelligence
description: A nude portrait of a crouching woman, hidden beneath the surface of a Pablo Picasso painting, has been revealed using artificial intelligence, advanced imaging technology and 3D printing.

title: Hear from William Shatner and crew ahead of Blue Origin space flight
description: William Shatner, Audrey Powers, Chris Boshuizen and Glen de Vries speak with CNN's Erica Hill about their upcoming suborbital flight onboard a New Shepard spacecraft.

title: Afghan interpreter who helped rescue Biden in 2008 gets out of Afghanistan
description: An Afghan interpreter who helped rescue then-Sen. Joe Biden after his helicopter was forced to land in a snowstorm 13 years ago has left Afghanistan, sources familiar tell CNN.

title: Climate crisis is 'single biggest health threat facing humanity,' WHO says
Nedumudi Venu, acclaimed Indian film actor, dies aged 73
description: Indian film star Nedumudi Venu has died at the age of 73, the doctor treating him has confirmed.

title: 'We felt the danger': Syria hit hard by Delta variant
description: CNN's Jomana Karadsheh reports as Idlib province in northwest Syria is ravaged by a Covid-19 outbreak.

title: Granville Adams, 'Oz' actor, has died
description: Granville Adams, who starred as Zahir Arif on HBO's "Oz," has died following a lengthy battle with cancer, according to a statement shared by his family.

title: Adele on Instagram Live was everything
description: Adele didn't really know what she was doing on Instagram Live, but it was both charming and revelatory.

title: Death of a 15-year-old mother exposes dark practice of child marriage in Zimbabwe
description: Faith and her other teenage friends sit outside in the bright sun while waiting for their Taekwondo session to start in Epworth, a township southeast of central Harare.

title: Her mother died from an unsafe abortion. She fears other women are at risk
description: Outside the only abortion clinic in the border city of McAllen, Texas, a debate has played out for years. Some people pray and beg patients to not go inside as some volunteers escort patients to the entrance. But none of them were there when Rosie Jimenez died just across the street more than 40 years ago.

title: London police taking 'no further action' over Prince Andrew review
description: London's police force has decided to take "no further action" against Prince Andrew, the Duke of York, following a review sparked by Virginia Roberts Giuffre, who has filed a lawsuit against him in New York for alleged sexual abuse.

title: Economics Nobel rewards research that showed minimum wage didn't cut jobs
description: David Card, Joshua Angrist and Guido Imbens have been awarded the 2021 Nobel Prize in economic sciences for contributions to labor economics and analysis of causal relationships, the Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences announced on Monday.

title: Trial over murder of 'Africa's Che Guevara' opens in Burkina Faso
description: The trial of 14 people accused of plotting to assassinate Burkina Faso's former president Thomas Sankara started on Monday, more than 30 years after he was gunned down in one of the most infamous killings in modern African history.

title: Jesy Nelson responds to charges of Blackfishing after debut video release
description: Jesy Nelson is addressing accusations of Blackfishing and cultural appropriation leveled against her following the release of her new music video on Friday.

title: Czech President's condition 'stable' after post-election hospitalization
description: Czech President Miloš Zeman was in intensive care on Sunday, shortly after holding talks with the country's populist prime minister whose leadership hangs in the balance following a dramatic election.

title: Nearly 19,000 children crossed the dangerous Darien Gap on foot this year
description: A record number of children crossed on foot the treacherous stretch of jungle between Colombia and Panama known as the Darien Gap this year: 19,000, half of whom were under 5 years old, according to UNICEF.

title: Tennis star pledges to donate $50,000 prize money to World Mental Health Day
description: Tennis star Iga Swiatek says she will be donating $50,000 of her prize money in support of World Mental Health Day, after progressing to the last 16 of the BNP Paribas Open at Indian Wells on Sunday.

title: George Clooney compares Biden's struggles to 'battered child' after Trump
description: In a BBC interview, George Clooney recalls knowing Donald Trump before his presidency. Chief media adviser to George W. Bush and John McCain campaigns Mark McKinnon reacts to the actor's account.

title: Goldman Sachs gets even gloomier
description: Goldman Sachs is becoming increasingly pessimistic about the US economy as coronavirus support from the government phases out and consumer spending remains on an uncertain path.

title: The traveler who's spent the entire pandemic backpacking
description: After working in a corporate job for a number of years, budding photographer Tomas Hromjak decided it was finally the right time to take the year-long backpacking trip he'd been planning for years.

title: France wins Nations League as VAR decision leaves Spain fuming
description: France came from behind to defeat Spain and claim the UEFA Nations League on Sunday thanks to goals from Karim Benzema and Kylian Mbappé.

title: Ko Jin-young equals golfing history with dominant Founders Cup win
description: In 2019, Ko Jin-young broke a golf legend's record, and on Sunday, she matched another legend's record in her dominant Founders Cup victory.

title: Timothée Chalamet shares first pictures of his Willy Wonka transformation
description: Timothée Chalamet has teased a first look at his portrayal of iconic candy man Willy Wonka in the upcoming film "Wonka."

title: Chinese coal prices hit record high and power cuts continue
description: Flooding in northern China is hitting a major coal production center hard, sending coal prices soaring and complicating efforts by Beijing to tackle ongoing power shortages.

title: Neymar says the 2022 World Cup could be his last
description: Brazilian footballer Neymar has said that he thinks next year's FIFA World Cup in Qatar could be his last.

title: Cincinnati Bengals kicker Evan McPherson celebrates game-winning overtime kick. But he actually missed
description: Cincinnati Bengals kicker Evan McPherson had a moment to forget on Sunday during his team's thrilling clash with the Green Bay Packers.

title: Australia's biggest city is starting to live with Covid. Other countries will be watching
China celebrates growth in wealth, power -- and height
description: Last week, as China celebrated the 72nd anniversary of Communist Party rule with a week-long public holiday, state-run media cranked up the patriotism to hail the country's economic rise, military achievements, political clout -- and even the height of its men.

title: Republican triumph in Virginia could further weaken Biden
description: Virginia Democrat Terry McAuliffe has admitted President Joe Biden's political woes drag on his gubernatorial campaign. But they pale against the shockwaves that would rip through the White House if he loses his race next month at a perilous time for the party in Washington.

title: 'Sense of relief' sweeps across Sydney as Covid lockdown eases
description: One major city that is emerging from Covid-19 lockdowns is Sydney. More than five million people have endured a strict lockdown since June, but Australian officials lifted measures after hitting a 70% vaccination rate. CNN's Angus Watson has more.

title: The surreal beauty of Earth's northernmost buildings
description: The Arctic invites images of emptiness. Harsh temperatures lead to barren, sparsely populated landscapes beyond the reach of most travelers. This inaccessibility is what first drew Austrian photographer Gregor Sailer to the region.

title: US Capitol Police whistleblower alleges leadership failures on January 6
description: A whistleblower identifying as a former high-ranking US Capitol Police official excoriated the department's leadership before, during and after the deadly January 6 insurrection in a new letter to Congress.
